name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: [SOUND].

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: There are some interesting challenges in threshold.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: Would have known in the filtering problem.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _So here I show the
column6: sort of the data that you can collect in

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: in the filtering system.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: So you can see the scores and the status of relevance.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _So the first one has a score 36.5

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: The second one is not relevant.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _Of course
column6: we have a lot of documents for which we don't know the status

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: because we will have to the user.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _So as you can see here

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: we only see the judgements of documents delivered to the user.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: So this is not a random sample.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: So it's a censored data.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _It's kind of biased
column6: so that creates some difficulty for learning. _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _And secondly
column6: there are in general very little labeled data and very few relevant _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _data
column7: it's also challenging for machine learning approaches. _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: Typically they require require more training data.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _And in the extreme case at the beginning

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _we don't even have any

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _The system still has to make a decision

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: that's a very difficult problem at the beginning.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _Finally
column6: the results of this issue of exploration versus exploitation tradeoff. _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: Now this means we also want to

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _explore the document space a little bit

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: might be interested in the documents that we have not yet labeled.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _So
column7: we're going to explore the space of user interests _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: by testing whether the user might be interested in some other documents that

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: currently are not matching the user's interest.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: This so well.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: So how do we do that?

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: Well we could lower the threshold a little bit and do we just deliver some near

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: misses to the user to see what the user would respond so

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _see how the user will
column6: would respond to this extra document. _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _And
column6: and this is a trade off

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _but on the other hand
column6: you don't want to really explore too much

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: because then you would over-deliver non-relevant information.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _So exploitation means you would
column6: exploit what you learn about the user. _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _And let's say you know the user is interested in this particular topic

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: you don't want to deviate that much.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _And
column6: but if you don't deviate at all
column7: then you don't explore at all. _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: That's also not good.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: You might miss opportunity to learn another interest of the user.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: So this is a dilemma.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: And that's also a difficult problem to solve.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: Now how do we solve these problems?

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _In general
column6: I think why can't I used the empirical utility optimization strategy? _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _And this strategy is basically to optimize the threshold based on

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _just as you have seen on the previous slide

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: So you can just compute the utility on the training data for

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: each candidate score threshold.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: Pretend that [INAUDIBLE] cut at this point.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _What if I cut out the [INAUDIBLE] threshold

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: What's utility?

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _Compute the utility

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _We know the status

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _approximation of click-throughs

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: So then we can just choose this threshold that gives the maximum

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: utility on the training data.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: Now but this of course doesn't account for exploration that we just talked about.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: And there is also the difficulty of bias.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _Training sample

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _So in general
column6: we can only get an upper bound or

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _because the
column7: the threshold might be actually lower than this. _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: So it's possible that the discarded item might be actually interesting to the user.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: So how do we solve this problem?

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: Well we generally as I said we can lower the threshold to explore a little bit.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: So here's one particular approach called the beta-gamma threshold learning.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _So the

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _So
column6: here I show a ranked list of _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: all the training documents that we have seen so far.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: And they are ranked by their positions.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _And on the Y-axis

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _Of course
column6: this function depends on how you specify the coefficients in _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: the Utility function.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: But we can not imagine depending on the cut off position we will have a utility.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: That means suppose I cut at this position and that will be the utility.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: So we can for example I then find some cut off point.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: The optimal point theta optimal is the point

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: when we would achieve the maximum utility if we had chosen this threshold.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _And there is also 0 threshold

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: As you can see at this cut off.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: The utility is 0.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _Now

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _That means if I lower the threshold
column7: and now I'm I reach this _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _threshold

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _Still non-elective

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _So it's not as high as the optimal utility

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: it gives us a a safe point to explore the threshold.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _As I just explained
column6: it's desirable to explore the interest space. _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: So it's desirable to lower the threshold based on your training data.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _So that means
column7: we want to set the threshold somewhere in this range. _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: It's the when user off fault to control the the deviation from

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: the optimal utility point.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: So you can see the formula of the threshold will be just the incorporation

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: of the zero utility threshold and the optimal between the threshold.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _Now the question is how
column6: how should we set r form

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: when should we deviate more from the optimal utility point.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: Well this can depend on multiple factors and the one way to solve the problem is to

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: encourage this threshold mechanism to explore

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _up the 0 point

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: we're not going to necessarily reach all the way to the 0 point.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: But rather we're going to use other parameters to further define alpha.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: And this specifically is as follows.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: So there will be a beta parameter to control.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: The deviation from the optimal threshold.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: And this can be based on for example can be accounting for

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: the over throughout the training data let's say.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: And so this can be just the adjustment factor.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _But what's more interesting is this gamma parameter here
column6: and you can see in this _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: formula gamma is controlling the the influence

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: of the number of examples in training data set.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: So you can see in this formula as N which denotes the number of training examples.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: Becomes bigger than it would actually encourage less exploration.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _In other words
column7: it will try to explore more. _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _And that just means if we have seen few examples

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: we're not sure whether we have exhausted the space of interests.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: So [INAUDIBLE].

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _But as we have seen many examples from the user

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: then we feel that we probably dont' have to explore more.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _So this gives us a dynamic of strategy for exploration

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _The more examples we have seen
column6: the less exploration we are going to do. _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _So
column6: the threshold will be closer to the optimal threshold. _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _So
column6: that's the basic idea of this approach. _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _Now
column7: has been working well in some evaluation studies. _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _And

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _And
column6: also can welcome arbitrary utility with a appropriate lower bound. _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: And explicitly addresses exploration-exploration tradeoff.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _And it kind of uses a zero in this threshold point as a

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: For exploration and exploiting tradeoff.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _We're not
column6: never going to explore further than the zero utility point. _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _So
column6: if you take the analogy of gambling

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: you don't want to risk losing money.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _You know

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _And the problem is

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: And the zero utility lower bound is also often too conservative.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _And there are
column7: calls are more advanced than machine learning _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: projects that have been proposed for solving these problems.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: And this is a very active research area.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: So to summarize there are two strategies for

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: recommending systems or filtering systems.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _One is content based
column6: which is looking at the item similarity. _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _And the other is collaborative filtering
column6: which is looking at the user similarity. _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: In this lecture we have covered content-based filtering approach.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _In the next lecture
column6: we're going to talk about collaborative filtering. _

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: The content-based filtering system we generally have to solve

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: _several problems related to filtering decision and learning

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: And such a system can actually be based on a search engine

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: system by adding a threshold mechanism and

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: adding adaptive learning algorithm to allow the system

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: to learn from long term feedback from the user.

name: 5 - 11 - 4.6  Recommender Systems- Content-based Filtering - Part 2 (00-10-42).srt
text: [MUSIC]
